Deploy Better L7 WAF Policies¶

This lab will deploy L7 WAF policies to protect NGINX+ and the applications that are running behind it.

In the previous lab the BIG-IP was acting as a L4 TCP proxy similar to a cloud proxy like an AWS NLB, Azure ALB, or Google Regional TCP Load Balancer.

The BIG-IP is capable of providing advanced DDoS and Web Application Firewall (WAF) protection.

Deploying a WAF Policy¶

On the K8S Master Node run the specified kubectl command.

This will update the ConfigMap and trigger the F5 BIG-IP Controller for Kubernetes to push a new updated configuration to the BIG-IP that is sitting outside the Kubernetes cluster.

$ kubectl apply -f ~/f5-cis/cis-better-together-configmap.yaml

Now you should be able to trigger the WAF policy by sending a contrived attack to steal coffee.

curl -k https://cafe.example.com/coffee -v -H "X-Hacker: cat /etc/paswd"

On the BIG-IP go to Security -> Event Logs and you should see the blocked request.
